VLIB Function Reference

Block Statistics

Introduction and Use Cases

This API will be useful in measuring various statical imformation of non overlapping blocks in image.

Specification

Function

Generates minimum, maximum, mean and variance information of image blocks

Variants

NA

Inputs


    Parameter              Description                                 DataType
    -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
    pInput[]         input data pointer                                (UQ8.0 )
    imageStride      stride between input lines, in elements           (UQ16.0)
    imageWidth       width of input data, in elements                  (UQ16.0)
    imageHeight      height of input data, in elements                 (UQ16.0)
    statBlockWidth   width of the statistics block                     (UQ8.0 )
    statBlockHeight  height of the statistics block                    (UQ8.0 )
    pMinimum[]       data pointer for minimum value for each block     (UQ8.0 )
    pMaximum[]       data pointer for maximum value for each block     (UQ8.0 )
    pMean[]          data pointer for mean value for each block        (UQ16.0)
    pVariance[]      data pointer for variance value for each block    (UQ32.0)
    pScratch[]       data pointer scratch buffer                       (UQ8.0 )
    mode             optimization mode (0 or 1)                        (UQ8.0 )

Outputs

    Returns VLIB Error Status

Method

  1. Minimum : This value is minimum value of the all the pixels present in given block
  2. Maximum : This value is maximum value of the all the pixels present in given block
  3. Mean : This value is equal to sum of all the pixels present in given block, which is equal to N*actual_mean of the pixels. Where N is total number of pixel in a block. In order to get actual mean, user must divide outputs by the block size.
  4. Variance: This value is sum of squares of all the pixel present in given block, times the number of pixels in the block, minus the square of sums of the block. (blockSize*sumSq - (blockSum)^2)

APIS

  • VLIB_blockStatistics

Notes

There are two optimization flow implemented for this kernel and those are
  • mode '0' - In most of the use case this mode of operation will give best result. However when block width is much higher than height then this mode of operation might not give best performance.
  • mode '1' - When block width is much higher than height then this mode of operation might give best performance.

References
